Bindleback, to be precise

Speaking of which, does Yorick have any currently-in-development skins? He's a top laner I don't play too often, but I do like him and hope he gets something good for all his trouble throughout the years.

> [{quoted}](name=Legacy Hydralpha,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=mIea1ATN,comment-id=00050002,timestamp=2017-04-28T00:49:34.326+0000)
>
> Speaking of which, does Yorick have any currently-in-development skins? He's a top laner I don't play too often, but I do like him and hope he gets something good for all his trouble throughout the years.

Kindlejack isn't going to answer.  Not because he/she may want to, but Riot has a history of not meeting expectations, especially their own.

(There's a reason why "Soon™" is still a meme around here.)

If they said "Yes, we're working on a Yorick skin," the expectation would be that one would be announced in the coming weeks.  However, if someone higher up the food chain (like Hippalus or WizardCrab) said "We can't sell this skin, so you need to start over," how would you (and millions of others) feel about the sudden change in plan?

Do they just let expectations linger (like they've done in the past), or do they say "we're sorry, but Yorick's skin was pulled for reasons and he's gone back to the idea pool" and ignore the backlash (like they've done in the past).

So, instead, we get a Rioter who claims to empathize with the pain that Yorick players feel yet is part of the problem that is causing that pain.
It's the Ao Shin effect.
Soon(tm) is used by multiple developers

> [{quoted}](name=Chicken Dynasty,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=mIea1ATN,comment-id=0005000200000002,timestamp=2017-04-28T23:48:34.042+0000)
>
> Soon(tm) is used by multiple developers

Few bigger or more memeworthy than Rito.

> [{quoted}](name=TerraRising,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=mIea1ATN,comment-id=000500020000,timestamp=2017-04-28T01:00:23.585+0000)
>
> Kindlejack isn't going to answer.  Not because he/she may want to, but Riot has a history of not meeting expectations, especially their own.

Not necessarily even just a Riot thing. This is pretty standard for product development stuff in general. It's why a lot of times Kickstarters fail: not all projects make it through to the end. There are some legitimately awful things that sounded like a good idea at the time, but get nixed when people realize how terrible they are. Others might be good, but not profitable enough to fully develop, or not as high priority as other concepts. That's one of the reasons leaks are a problem. Other than corporate espionage issues, it sets expectations for things that may or may not actually end up being things.
